summary: The Small Business Administration (SBA) provides funding to Small Business Development Centers to train and counsel small businesses. Since FY 2016, SBA has used the President’s proposed budget to estimate funding for the following year. For FY 2020, the President requested $101 million; Congress appropriated $135 million. The large gap between estimated and actual funding caused the centers to have to rework their budgets and...
title: Small Business Development Centers: Reevaluation of How SBA Sets Initial Funding Estimate Needed to Help Reduce Burden
